Package com.example.fairdraw.Fragments

Class FilterEventsDialogFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
com.example.fairdraw.Fragments.FilterEventsDialogFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentCallbacks, DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class FilterEventsDialogFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
DialogFragment that displays filter controls for the events list.

Hosts can supply the current filter values via newInstance(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int) and receive updates via FilterEventsDialogFragment.FilterListener.

  • Method Details

    • newInstance

      public static FilterEventsDialogFragment newInstance(String currentStatus, String currentInterest, int currentAvailability)
      Create a new FilterEventsDialogFragment with optional current values.
      Parameters:
      currentStatus - current status filter, or "All"
      currentInterest - current interest filter, or "All"
      currentAvailability - current availability or -1 for any
      Returns:
      configured FilterEventsDialogFragment

    • setFilterListener

      public void setFilterListener(FilterEventsDialogFragment.FilterListener listener)
      Set a listener which will receive filter events.
      Parameters:
      listener - the FilterListener to notify

    • onCreateDialog

      @NonNull public Dialog onCreateDialog(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Create the dialog UI used to pick filters. Reads the arguments (if any) to pre-select the controls and notifies the FilterEventsDialogFragment.FilterListener when the user taps Apply or Clear.
      Overrides:
      onCreateDialog in class androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
      Parameters:
      savedInstanceState - saved bundle provided by the system (may be null)
      Returns:
      a configured Dialog displaying filter controls
